properties.name: appearance
properties.description: Specifies the appearance of the content control.

examples.description: Set a date picker content control's appearance to show only bounding box borders without displaying tags

properties.name: color
properties.description: Specifies the red-green-blue (RGB) value of the color of the content control. You can provide the value in the '#RRGGBB' format.

examples.description: Set the color of a date picker content control to blue (#0000FF)

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a date picker content control to verify the connection to the Word host application and log its properties.

properties.name: dateCalendarType
properties.description: Specifies a CalendarType value that represents the calendar type for the date picker content control.

examples.description: Set a date picker content control to use the Hebrew calendar type

properties.name: dateDisplayFormat
properties.description: Specifies the format in which dates are displayed.

examples.description: Set the date display format to "MMMM d, yyyy" (e.g., "January 15, 2024") for a date picker content control

properties.name: dateDisplayLocale
properties.description: Specifies a LanguageId that represents the language format for the date displayed in the date picker content control.

examples.description: Set the date display format in a date picker content control to use French (France) locale

properties.name: dateStorageFormat
properties.description: Specifies a ContentControlDateStorageFormat value that represents the format for storage and retrieval of dates when the date picker content control is bound to the XML data store of the active document.

examples.description: Set a date picker content control to store dates in DateTime format when bound to XML data

properties.name: id
properties.description: Gets the identification for the content control.

examples.description: Get and display the ID of a date picker content control in the document

properties.name: isTemporary
properties.description: Specifies whether to remove the content control from the active document when the user edits the contents of the control.

examples.description: Set a date picker content control to be automatically removed from the document when the user edits its content

properties.name: level
properties.description: Specifies the level of the content controlâwhether the content control surrounds text, paragraphs, table cells, or table rows; or if it is inline.

examples.description: Check if a date picker content control is inline or at paragraph level and display the level information to the user.

properties.name: lockContentControl
properties.description: Specifies if the content control is locked (can't be deleted). true means that the user can't delete it from the active document, false means it can be deleted.

examples.description: Lock a date picker content control to prevent users from deleting it from the document

properties.name: lockContents
properties.description: Specifies if the contents of the content control are locked (not editable). true means the user can't edit the contents, false means the contents are editable.

examples.description: Lock the contents of a date picker content control to prevent users from editing the selected date

properties.name: placeholderText
properties.description: Returns a BuildingBlock object that represents the placeholder text for the content control.

examples.description: Get and display the placeholder text content from a date picker content control by accessing its BuildingBlock object.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Gets a Range object that represents the contents of the content control in the active document.

examples.description: Get the text content from a date picker content control and display it in the console.

properties.name: showingPlaceholderText
properties.description: Gets whether the placeholder text for the content control is being displayed.

examples.description: Check if a date picker content control is showing placeholder text and display an alert with the result.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: Specifies a tag to identify the content control.

examples.description: Set a tag "birthdate-field" on a date picker content control to identify it for later retrieval or processing

properties.name: title
properties.description: Specifies the title for the content control.

examples.description: Set the title of a date picker content control to "Project Deadline"

properties.name: xmlMapping
properties.description: Gets an XmlMapping object that represents the mapping of the content control to XML data in the data store of the document.

examples.description: Check if a date picker content control has an XML mapping and display the mapping's XPath if it exists.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Copies the content control from the active document to the Clipboard.

examples.description: Copy a date picker content control to the clipboard so it can be pasted elsewhere in the document

methods.name: cut
methods.description: Removes the content control from the active document and moves the content control to the Clipboard.

examples.description: Remove a date picker content control from the document and move it to the clipboard so it can be pasted elsewhere

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this content control and the contents of the content control.

params.name: deleteContents
params.description: Optional. If true, deletes the contents as well.

examples.description: Delete a date picker content control and its contents from the document

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the date value and title properties of the first date picker content control in the document.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Configure multiple properties of a date picker content control at once, including its title, placeholder text, and date display format.

methods.name: setPlaceholderText
methods.description: Sets the placeholder text that displays in the content control until a user enters their own text.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. The options for configuring the content control's placeholder text.

examples.description: Set placeholder text "Select a date..." for a date picker content control at the beginning of the document.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.DatePickerContentControl object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.DatePickerContentControlData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a date picker content control to JSON format for logging or data transfer purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a date picker content control across multiple sync calls to prevent InvalidObjectPath errors when accessing its properties after document changes

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Track a date picker content control, modify its properties, then untrack it to release memory after the operations are complete.
